headline: Former Weissport police chief found guilty of raping a child
author: Emily Silvi
sentences: WEISSPORT, CARBON COUNTY (WBRE/WYOU) — Pennsylvania Attorney General Josh Shapiro announced Friday that a jury has rendered a guilty verdict for former Weissport Chief of Police Brent Getz for raping a child.
“This verdict holds Brent Getz accountable for his horrific crimes against a child, and brought justice to a brave survivor who had the courage to come forward,” said Shapiro.
30-year-old Brent Getz, of Lehighton, has been found guilty of raping a child, he was originally charged back in March 2019.
Police say the assaults started when she was four years old, and continued regularly for seven years.
Getz’s co-defendant, Gregory Wagner, pleaded guilty and testified against Getz.
Getz and Wagner will be sentenced at a later date.
